Experience Maintenance Technician Intel Corporation May 2005  – Present (10 years 4 months) Ireland Perform electrical and mechanical troubleshooting to determine problems in non-functioning electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing process.  
Use defect analysis for troubleshooting... 
Dismantle, adjust, repair, and assemble equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, operating or repair manuals, rough sketches or drawings. 
Also perform set-up, calibration, and preventative maintenance on production equipment.  
Assignments are semi-routine in nature, helping to hone skills on equipment, suggest possible training improvements. 
Work is performed within generally defined parameters.  
A degree of judgment is required in resolving non-standard problems.  
Perform Scheduled maintenance tasks.  
Update and maintain maintenance procedures streamlining tasks to reduce downtime.  
Follow the LEAN ideology of removing wastage from manufacturing environment by reducing costs and time for process, improving efficiencies during maintenance tasks. 
Inform Manager of expected downtime and ensure tasks are completed within time-frame, post-mortems given for any extra time required on equipment recovery after PMs.  
Error recovery, within minimal time, detailed post-mortems on the route cause and possible fixes to prevent same error and or reduced downtime. 
Give and Receive a passdown on status of equipment at the start and end of each shift, this ensures that everyone is aware of current tool issues.  
Liaise with equipment owner (Engineer) on all of the above issues and work with them on increasing equipment efficiency.  
Be involved with any scheduled upgrades on equipment and have a good base of knowledge.  
Give and receive training on equipment to ensure team is up to speed on correct tool running and recovery procedures etc.  
Implementation of SCANDO to ensure that equipment availability is there for each shift to perform core roles. 
Also have traveled to suit company needs.
